course_title: 20th Century Art and Culture: The Triumph and Demise of Modernism

sections.comments: ARTH 340 001 will be delivered 100% online, with some synchronous (i.e., "real time") and some asynchronous components.This course provides a critical overview of twentieth-century visual arts in Europe and its North American diaspora situated within their social, political, and historical contexts up until and including the 1960s, with a special emphasis on major movements of the historic avant-garde. These include Modernism, Expressionism, Cubism, Futurism, Constructivism, Dada, Surrealism, Abstract Expressionism, and Pop.
ARTH 340 01W is a waitlist for ARTH 340 001. As seats become available, students will be moved from the waitlist into the lecture based on date of registration and then notified by email.

description: A critical survey of western art and cultural production from the turn of the century to the development of Pop Art.
